metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11343 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
Due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-6125, all versions of CHICKEN Scheme up to and including 4.12.0 are vulnerable to an algorithmic complexity attack. An attacker can provide crafted input which, when inserted into the symbol table, will result in O(n) lookup time.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-11343` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.12.0-0.3
libchicken11 - 4.12.0-0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chicken package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.12.0-0.3').
